metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the unix-def:password_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evaluate to true if the interpreter properly supports unix-def:password_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that the password_object is supported with the username entity equal to some value.
Test that the password_object is supported with the username entity not equal to some value.
Test that the password_object is supported with the username entity matching some regular expression.
Test that the password_object is supported with the username entity equal to some value using the var_ref attribute.
Test that the password_object is supported with the username entity not equal to some value using the var_ref attribute.
Test that the password_object is supported with the username entity matching some regular expression using the var_ref attribute.

password_test.comment: Test that the password_object is supported with the username entity equal to some value.
Test that the password_object is supported with the username entity not equal to some value.
Test that the password_object is supported with the username entity matching some regular expression.
Test that the password_object is supported with the username entity equal to some value using the var_ref attribute.
Test that the password_object is supported with the username entity not equal to some value using the var_ref attribute.
Test that the password_object is supported with the username entity matching some regular expression using the var_ref attribute.

password_object.comment: This object represents a password_object where the username equals 'root'.
This object represents a password_object where the username does not equal 'root'.
This object represents a password_object where the username matches the regular expression '^[^r]'.
This object represents a password_object where the username equals 'root' using the var_ref attribute.
This object represents a password_object where the username does not equal 'root' using the var_ref attribute.
This object represents a password_object where the username matches the regular expression '^[^r]' using the var_ref attribute.

password_state.comment: This password_state represents a password_object where the user_id equals '0'.
This password_state represents a password_object where the user_id equals '1'.

constant_variable.comment: This constant_variable represents the string value 'root'.
This constant_variable represents the string value '^[^r]'.
